title: How to Make Turkey Meatloaf

steps.headline: Cook the onions, olive oil, seasonings, and thyme over medium-low heat.
steps.description: Cook for about 15 minutes or until the onions appear translucent in color.

steps.headline: Mix the chicken stock, tomato paste, and Worcestershire sauce into the pan.
Remove from the heat and cool the mixture to room temperature.
Mix the ground turkey, beaten eggs, bread crumbs, and onion sauce mixture in a large bowl.
Shape and press the mixture down in a rectangular loaf pan.
steps.description: Evenly spread the ketchup on top.

steps.headline: Place the pan in the oven and bake for 1 1/2 hours.
Allow the meatloaf to cool and serve.

text: Preheat the oven to 325ºF/160ºC.  Cook the onions, olive oil, seasonings, and thyme over medium-low heat. Cook for about 15 minutes or until the onions appear translucent in color. Mix the chicken stock, tomato paste, and Worcestershire sauce into the pan.  Remove from the heat and cool the mixture to room temperature.  Mix the ground turkey, beaten eggs, bread crumbs, and onion sauce mixture in a large bowl.  Shape and press the mixture down in a rectangular loaf pan. Evenly spread the ketchup on top. Place the pan in the oven and bake for 1 1/2 hours.  Allow the meatloaf to cool and serve.
